item.title: After bitter bidding war, N.J. home sold for $186k above asking price
item.description: A newer construction home in Bloomfield recently ignited a bidding war that brought its sale price up 27% over the asking price. The four bedroom, four bathroom Colonial was listed June 16 for $689,000 and closed August 16 for $875,050. “The lack of inventory in this price range is so severe that there are many, many, many qualified buyers searching for the same home,” said Elizabeth Morris of Prominent Properties Sotheby’s International Realty, the listing agent for the home.

item.title: N.J. is home to 2 of top 50 hottest housing markets in U.S.
item.description: Two New Jersey counties were among the top 50 hottest housing markets in the country last month based on how quickly homes were selling and overall interest in listings, data from Realtor.com showed. The Allentown-Bethlehem-Easton metro area, which primarily is in Pennsylvania, but also includes Warren County in New Jersey, ranked 24 on the top 100 for hottest housing markets, according to Realtor.com. The median listing price in the Lehigh Valley area was $375,000 in July.
